TopicTitle: Twitch Thursday: EJ_SA is going pro!

Articles.Content:
<figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480" src="http://40.media.tumblr.com/e6b9796e0425d604ccf4dd4df2733721/tumblr_inline_nuh57dgZdC1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><br/><object bgcolor="#000000" data="http://www.twitch.tv/swflibs/TwitchPlayer.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="620"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/swflibs/TwitchPlayer.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="channel=ej_sa&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&videoId=v15276367&device_id=ba57eb55aa8ebfd4"></object>

<p>Many people will know or at least have heard of EJ_SAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s streams. EJ has been streaming KSP on Twitch pretty much since the formation of the planet Earth, building collosal vehicles and space stations, though the Space Shuttle has been a vehicle that always had a special place in his repertoire. <br/></p><p>EJÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s builds are impressive from their large size down to the small details and engineering solutions: he used complex mechanisms with RCS, cubic octagonal struts and docking ports to build hinges for cargo bay doors, before the game included a stock solution. His Shuttles measured more than a thousand parts, and he even made a 3D model of the shuttle live on Stream in Maya.</p><p>ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s much more to say, but the most important thing is that EJ announced that in about 10 days time heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to be a full time streamer, and we wish him the best of luck with that. Subscribe to his channel, because youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll miss out if you donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t.<br/></p>

WOOOHOOO! I shall forever support him and his channel. Definitely give him a follow guys . Him and his Space agency are well worth it.

Edited September 10, 2015 by Avera9eJoe

Right, so commercial use of Kerbal Space Program is allowed - as long as it's for videos.

Early access to releases is available for the 'media' team - as long as the medium they work in is video.

Written work still not welcome. Gotcha.

Since I, like many people, have to pay for broadband by the gigabyte, I won't be watching.

All the best to EJ. His streams are nominal.

Edited September 11, 2015 by klgraham1013

EJ cherishes his Kerbals' lives and stock KSP more than anyone. If Squad ever implements KSC door interactions to recover Kerbals, he'll gladly use them after every mission.

Love his ladder truck :3
Nice! Grats to you EJ! Love watching you stream when i cant catch ya!

Grats EJ!

I look forward to seeing what you have in store
